course description: Negotiation and Conflict Resolution - Covers principled negotiation strategies integrating theory and practice across business and interpersonal contexts.
Advanced Negotiation - Explores complex multi-party negotiations and cross-cultural bargaining tactics.
Legal Negotiation and Mediation - Focuses on dispute resolution techniques and mediation processes in legal settings.
Leadership and Organizational Behavior - Examines leadership styles team dynamics and motivational theories in organizations.
Principles of Management - Introduction to management functions including planning organizing leading and controlling.
Consumer Behavior - Study of psychological social and cultural factors influencing consumer decision-making.
Marketing Strategy - Covers market segmentation targeting positioning and the marketing mix.
Corporate Finance - Analysis of financial decision-making capital budgeting and risk management.
Investment Analysis - Covers portfolio theory equity valuation and fixed income securities.
Interpersonal Communication - Explores verbal and nonverbal communication in personal and professional relationships.
Persuasion and Influence - Examines theories of attitude change rhetoric and persuasive communication.
Microeconomics - Fundamental principles of supply demand market structures and consumer choice.
Game Theory and Strategic Behavior - Applies mathematical models to strategic decision-making and competitive interactions.
Introduction to Programming - Fundamentals of programming using Python including data structures control flow and functions.
Data Structures and Algorithms - In-depth study of arrays trees graphs sorting and algorithm complexity.
Machine Learning - Introduction to supervised and unsupervised learning neural networks and model evaluation.
Introduction to Data Science - Covers data wrangling visualization statistics and introductory machine learning.
Introduction to Psychology - Survey of major areas in psychology including cognition perception development and behavior.
Social Psychology - Examines how individuals are influenced by social contexts groups and cultural norms.
Ethics and Moral Philosophy - Introduction to ethical theory covering utilitarianism deontology and virtue ethics.
